overview: This is a bill for an act making appropriations for claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. [1] The bill makes appropriations and approves payments for claims against the State, its officers, and its employees for fiscal year 2024-2025. [1] The appropriations are for the purpose of satisfying claims for legislative relief, for the overpayment of taxes, or for refunds, reimbursements, payments of judgments or settlements, or other liabilities. [1]
appropriations: The legislative document specifies $998,335.75 (HB990_.HTM.txt) is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii to the department of the attorney general for miscellaneous claims and claims against the Department of Land and Natural Resources. [1] The legislative document specifies $1,250,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt) is appropriated out of the state highway fund for claims against the Department of Transportation, Highways Division. [1] The legislative document specifies $90,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt) is appropriated out of Judiciary funds for a claim against the Judiciary. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The appropriations are for specific, named claims against the State. [1] The amounts are set forth opposite the names of the persons, firms, corporations, and entities involved. [1] The sums are for the satisfaction or settlement of the respectively identified cases. [1]
agency_impact: The sums appropriated from general revenues shall be expended by the department of the attorney general. [1] The sums appropriated from the state highway fund shall be expended by the department of transportation, highways division. [1] The sum appropriated from Judiciary funds shall be expended by the Judiciary. [1] All departments shall obtain the approval of the attorney general before payment of any claim may be made. [1]
economic_impact: This measure makes appropriations for the purpose of satisfying claims for legislative relief. [1] Payments are made for judgments or settlements, or other liabilities. [1] The sums may be paid to the respective persons, firms, corporations, or entities for the satisfaction or settlement of the respectively identified cases. [1]
policy_impact: This bill makes appropriations for claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. [1] Payment of interest upon judgments against the State shall be limited to the period from the date of the judgment, if applicable, to thirty days after the effective date of this Act, as provided in section 662-8, Hawaii Revised Statutes. [1] If any provision of this Act is held invalid, the invalidity does not affect other provisions or applications of the Act. [1]
revenue_sources: Part I of the bill appropriates sums out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] Part II appropriates sums out of the state highway fund. [1] Part III appropriates sums out of the Judiciary funds. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The appropriations in this bill are for the fiscal year 2024-2025. [1] All unexpended and unencumbered balances of the appropriations made in this Act as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse. [1] Part I appropriates $998,335.75 (HB990_.HTM.txt) from general revenues for claims including miscellaneous claims totaling $448,335.75 (HB990_.HTM.txt) and Department of Land and Natural Resources claims totaling $550,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt). [1] The miscellaneous claims include payments to Maui Kupono Builders for $442,504.75 (HB990_.HTM.txt), Sarah Ann D. Pacheco for $460.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt), and Kiyoji Tanimura for $5,371.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt). [1] The Department of Land and Natural Resources claims include a settlement for Jennifer Reber for $450,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt) and a tort claim for Brenda Osmer for $100,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt). [1] Part II appropriates a total of $1,250,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt) from the state highway fund for claims against the Department of Transportation, Highways Division. [1] This includes a settlement for Juan Jimmie Lee Aldeguer for $1,075,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt) and a settlement for the Estate of Bruce Perdue for $175,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt). [1] Part III appropriates a total of $90,000.00 (HB990_.HTM.txt) from Judiciary funds for a settlement in the case of Leanne Rosa v. Randall G.B. Valenciano. [1] These are one-time appropriations and do not imply recurring costs in the subsequent five years. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: This measure makes appropriations to pay for claims and does not generate revenue. [1] The bill appropriates funds out of general revenues, the state highway fund, and Judiciary funds. [1] No impact on operating revenues is anticipated. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: This bill makes appropriations for claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. [1] The funds are for payments of judgments or settlements, or other liabilities. [1] There are no capital expenditures identified in this measure. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: There are no fiscal implications after the six-year period. [1] All unexpended and unencumbered balances of the appropriations made in this Act as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse. [1] These appropriations are for specific claims for fiscal year 2024-2025 and are not recurring. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: A previous fiscal note was not provided.
